intro: Lycocarpus, commonly known as the "screw pine," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are characterized by their unique, spirally arranged leaves that give them a distinctive appearance. Lycocarpus species are typically shrubs or small trees, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. They have a fibrous root system and produce small, inconspicuous flowers. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value or used in traditional medicine.
